text:
Redfield is a city in Bourbon County, Kansas, United States. In 2010, 146 people lived there.
History.
Redfield was founded in 1866. The city was named for Dr. Redfield, an early settler. The first post office in Redfield was created in 1872. Throughout the 20th century, the town was served by the Missouri Pacific Railroad.
Geography.
Redfield is at (37.836301, -94.880922), along the Marmaton River. According to the United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of. All of it is land.
Climate.
Redfield has hot, humid summers and generally mild to cool winters. According to the Köppen Climate Classification system says that Redfield has a humid subtropical climate, abbreviated "Cfa" on climate maps.
2010 census.
As of the 2010 census says that there were 146 people, 53 households, and 33 families living in the city.
